title: Ba2+ and EDTA - ion conc. from large K, dilution

content.question:
Ba2+(aq) + EDTA4-(aq) ⇄ Ba(EDTA)2-(aq)        K = 7.7 × 107

The polyatomic ion C10H12N2O84- is commonly abbreviated as EDTA4-. The ion can form complexes with metal ions in aqueous solutions. A complex of EDTA4- with Ba2+ ion forms according to the equation above. A 50.0 mL volume of a solution that has an EDTA4-(aq) concentration of 0.30 M is mixed with 50.0 mL of 0.20 M Ba(NO3)2 to produce 100.0 mL of solution.

Considering the value of K for the reaction, determine the concentration of Ba(EDTA)2-(aq) in the 100.0 mL of solution. Justify your answer.

The solution is diluted with distilled water to a total volume of 1.00 L. After equilibrium has been reestablished, is the number of moles of Ba2+(aq) present in the solution greater than, less than, or equal to the number of moles of Ba2+(aq) present in the original solution before it was diluted? Justify your answer.

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
